title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox are predicted to be active in free agency with $25 million before the first luxury tax threshold.
Insiders suggest Red Sox could re-sign Alex Bregman or target Kyle Schwarber, Pete Alonso, and Munetaka Murakami.
Red Sox considered among best fits for pitchers Dylan Cease and Framber Valdez with multiple contract projections analyzed.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway, showcasing his career from his debut album 'Get Lifted'.
The setlist included a mix of Legend's original songs and covers, featuring artists like Kanye West and Alicia Keys.
Legend's performance highlighted his musical versatility, blending genres from R&B to gospel with confidence and showmanship.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officiating after the Celtics' 123-110 loss to the Magic, citing issues in the fourth quarter.
Brown expressed frustration over officiating following a prior game against the Jazz, but avoided further comments to prevent a fine.
In the loss to the Magic, Brown scored 32 points but only managed 2 points in the fourth quarter, acknowledging his shooting struggles.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Baker Mayfield, MVP candidate, has led Buccaneers to 6-2 with strong deep passing; struggles in short, intermediate throws.
Buccaneers rookie Emeka Egbuka, 562 yards and five touchdowns, returns from injury; faces Patriots' strong man coverage defense.
Tampa Bay's defense ranks seventh in DVOA, led by Vita Vea, Jamel Dean, and Antoine Winfield Jr., with strong pass and rush defense.

title: Patriots’ return to relevance includes appearance by Jim Nantz in TV booth to call game for CBS
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jim Nantz and Tony Romo will call the Patriots-Buccaneers game on CBS for the first time since 2023.
Nantz and Romo's assignment signifies the Patriots' renewed relevance with quarterback Drake Maye and coach Mike Vrabel.
The game marks Nantz and Romo's return to calling Patriots games, replacing a previously scheduled Bills-Dolphins matchup.

title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Celtics lost 123-110 to the Magic, marking their first defeat in the NBA Cup.
Jaylen Brown scored 32 points with 15-for-28 shooting but struggled from three-point range, going 1-for-6.
The Magic capitalized on three-point shooting, making 17 of 36 attempts, while Celtics centers underperformed.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts Judge Shelley Joseph recommended for public reprimand related to 2018 incident involving ICE, but cleared of misconduct.
Hearing officer found Joseph unaware of escape plan, but created appearance of impropriety by violating court rule.
Federal charges against Joseph were dropped in 2022; she was previously suspended in connection to obstruction accusations.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: The Boston Red Sox were eliminated by the Yankees in the AL Wild Card Series, losing two games to one.
Shortstop Trevor Story remained under contract, Alex Bregman opted out, and no qualifying offer was extended to Lucas Giolito.
Manager Alex Cora expressed optimism, calling the past season a step forward and anticipating future success for the team.

title: Giant blade breaks off Mass. wind turbine
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A 75 to 100-foot blade broke off a 300-foot wind turbine in Plymouth and fell into a cranberry bog.
The incident occurred near 810 Head of the Bay Road and was reported around 2 p.m. on Friday; no injuries occurred.
The turbine entered fail-safe mode and shut down; the area was secured and remains under investigation by authorities.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' is streaming on Disney+, featuring Pedro Pascal and Vanessa Kirby in the latest MCU adaptation.
Guillermo del Toro's film 'Frankenstein,' starring Oscar Isaac, is now available to stream on Netflix.
'Squid Game: The Challenge' Season 2, featuring Malden resident Eric Eldridge, can be watched on Netflix.
